medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presented with sharp, stabbing epigastric pain near the right upper quadrant (RUQ) for 1 day. The pain was nonradiating and not associated with vomiting but accompanied by nausea. It started after eating fried food and has never happened before. The pain remains persistent.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Obscure gastrointestinal bleeding (GIB) with a history of deep enteroscopy and cauterization of small bowel bleed; atrial fibrillation not on anticoagulation due to recurrent falls; coronary artery disease status post left anterior descending (LAD) percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI); congestive heart failure with unknown ejection fraction; severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) on 2L nasal cannula.
